messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Re:Gushing
messages.msgSnippet: I live in Savannah and he s right. Wendy ... From: Liza Sabater [mailto:liza@culturekitchen.com] Sent: Sunday, November 24, 2002 11:14 PM To:
messages.messageBody:
I live in Savannah and he's right.

Wendy
-----Original Message-----
From: Liza Sabater [mailto:liza@...]
Sent: Sunday, November 24, 2002 11:14 PM
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Re:Gushing


HAHAHAHAHAHAAHHAHAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAAHAHAHAHAHA

snort

HAHAHAHAHAHAAHHAHAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAAHAHAHAHAHA

sigh!

I was totally floored when my brother said he felt at home in
Savannah, GA. I was like WHAT? THE SOUTH! And he would say, no
really, they are so Puerto Rican! And now I know! In Puerto Rico
they'll finish it off with an "¡Ay, bendito!" which is more like "Oh,
blessed!".

Snorting profusely,
Liza


>In a message dated 11/23/2002 8:42:56 PM Eastern Standard Time,
>AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
>
>
>> Only because at work, there is this very Southern Belle type woman (a
>> stereotype that has some truth to it) that I know has some racist
feelings
>> due to comments she's made.
>> She's very, very syrupy and fake, I've caught her lying to me while
being
>> super sweet....gag.
>>
>
>I have a friend who lives in SC who described an interesting phenomenom.
He
>told about these women in the south who would say the most horrid things
>about something, that was made, ostensibly, okay, because it was followed
by
>"Bless her heart!" "Emmeline Lou is such a slutty pig, and she smells,
and
>her children wear rags...Bless her heart!"
>
>Kathryn
>

messages.subject: Re:Gushing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/23/2002 8:42:56 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... I have a friend who lives in SC who described an interesting phenomenom. He told about
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/23/2002 8:42:56 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Only because at work, there is this very Southern Belle type woman (a
> stereotype that has some truth to it) that I know has some racist feelings
> due to comments she's made.
> She's very, very syrupy and fake, I've caught her lying to me while being
> super sweet....gag.
>

I have a friend who lives in SC who described an interesting phenomenom. He
told about these women in the south who would say the most horrid things
about something, that was made, ostensibly, okay, because it was followed by
"Bless her heart!" "Emmeline Lou is such a slutty pig, and she smells, and
her children wear rags...Bless her heart!"

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
